dc:description:
HPS4 was first reported in relation to Autosomal Recessive Hermasky-Pudlak syndrome 4 in 2002
(Suzuki et al., PMID: 11836498). At least 20 unique variants, mostly nonsense and frameshift, but also a few missense variants have been reported in humans. HPS4 is involved in organelle biogenesis associated with melanosomes, platelet dense granules, and lysosomes. Hermansky-Pudlak syndrome 4 is characterized by oculocutaneous albinism and a bleeding diathesis, but in some cases, also pulmonary fibrosis and granulomatous colitis. Evidence supporting this gene-disease relationship includes case-level data and experimental data.  
  
Summary of Case Level Data: 12 Points 
Variants in this gene have been reported in at least 9 probands in 7 publications (PMIDs: 24433314, 15108212, 30990103, 30791930, 29108692, 11836498, 31415434). More evidence is available in the literature, but the maximum score for genetic evidence (12 pts.) has been reached. 
  
The mechanism for disease is homozygous loss of function (PMID: 11836498).   	 
  
Summary of Experimental Data: 5 Points 
This gene-disease association is supported by animal models and in vitro functional assays. The "light ear" or le mouse that carries a spontaneously occurring mutation in Hps4 recapitulates the human HPS phenotype (PMID: 11836498). Another spontaneously occurring HPS4 mutation is identified to be the cause of albinism in channel catfish (PMID: 28289846). HPS4 interacts with HPS1 to form BLOC-3, which is involved in the biogenesis of lysosome-related organelles (PMID: 11836498, 23103514).  

In summary, HPS4 is definitively associated with Autosomal Recessive Hermasky-Pudlak syndrome 4. 
This has been repeatedly demonstrated in both the research and clinical diagnostic settings, and has been upheld over time. This classification was approved by the ClinGen Hemostasis/Thrombosis GCEP on May 27, 2020 (SOP Version 7).

evidence.dc:description: The proband and his similarly affected sister were homozygous for the 1-bp duplication in exon 4 that results in a frameshift and premature termination in exon 10. NMD is predicted.

evidence.rdfs:label: Wu_Proband II.1
evidence.detectionMethod: The variant was identified by WES and confirmed by Sanger sequencing.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Proband had progressive dyspnea nd dry cough for 15 years. He also had interstitial pneumonia, severe restrictive ventilatory functional disturbance and suspected hypoxemic lung disease.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Platelet count, PT, aPTT and Fg level were normal.

evidence.dc:description: The proband and two other in the study were homozygous for the nonsense variant, (NM_022081.5) Gln181Ter in exon 7. NMD is predicted, the proband is scored default points

evidence.rdfs:label: Suzuki_Patient 13
evidence.detectionMethod: The authors amplified 13 coding exons of HPS4 from the genomic DNA of HPS patients and subjected the products to SSCP. Abnormal conformers were directly sequenced
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The patient is reported to have typical features of HPS and be of non-Puerto Rican origin
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Screening for HPS1 mutations did not reveal any variants.

evidence.dc:description: The proband was homozygous for the 1-bp deletion in exon 12, which results in a frameshift and PTC. NMD is not predicted since termination is expected to occur in the last exon. The proband is scored reduced points.

evidence.rdfs:label: Bachli_Proband
evidence.detectionMethod: The mutation was identified by PCR-SSCp and direct sequencing
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Albinism of skin detected through staining on skin biopsy.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Platelet count was normal. Blleding time was prolonged (>20min). Platelet function tests showed patient's platelets failed to aggregate with collagen, AA and ADP or epinephrine. FACS and TEM confirmed delta granule storage pool deficiency. TEM showed platelets lacked dense bodies.

evidence.dc:description:
The proband was homozygous for a 5-bp duplication in the last exon (14), (NM_022081.5) Lys699SerfsTer5. NMD is not predicted and the proband is scored reduced points.

Note, the paper reports the variant as "Q698insAAGCA frameshift". Per HGVS, this is written as NM_022081.5:c.2089_2093dup (p.Lys699SerfsTer5) and maps to ClinVar ID 4126.

evidence.rdfs:label: Suzuki_Patient 3
evidence.detectionMethod: The authors amplified 13 coding exons of HPS4 from the genomic DNA of HPS patients and subjected the products to SSCP. Abnormal conformers were directly sequenced
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The patient is reported to have typical features of HPS and be of non-Puerto Rican origin.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Screening for HPS1 mutations did not reveal any variants.

evidence.dc:description: The proband was homozygous for the nonsense variant, (NM_022081.5) Gln631Ter in exon 13, the penultimate exon. NMD is predicted.

evidence.rdfs:label: Suzuki_Patient 1
evidence.detectionMethod: The authors amplified 13 coding exons of HPS4 from the genomic DNA of HPS patients and subjected the products to SSCP. Abnormal conformers were directly sequenced.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The patient is reported to have typical features of HPS and be of non-Puerto Rican origin.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Screening for HPS1 mutations did not reveal any variants.

evidence.dc:description: The proband was homozygous for the (NM_022081.5) Gln244Ter variant in exon 10. NMD is predicted.

evidence.rdfs:label: Araki_Proband
evidence.detectionMethod: The mutation was identified by PCR-SSCp and direct sequencing.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Patient had oculocutaneous albinism, white/pink skin with blond hair, light gray irides, purpura on lower limbs, which gradually increased. Her hair had recently turned from slightly yellow to blond. Fundoscopy revealed translucent choroidal blood vessels and underdeveloped yellow spots. Patient had poor eyesight. Bleeding tendency was mild.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Platelet number and coagulation tests were normal. Bleeding time was slightly prolonged (>5min), indicating platelet storage pool deficiency. Screening for OCA-1, HPS1 and HPS3 did not reveal mutations.

evidence.dc:description: The proband was homozygous for the nonsense variant in exon 11, (NM_022081.5) Gln440Ter. NMD is predicted.

evidence.rdfs:label: Sandrock-Lang_Proband
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Platelet count and size, bleeding time, VWF, aPTT, PT were normal. Platelet aggregation with collagen, ADP, epinephrine, AA and ristocetin were impaired. ATP release after stimulation with thrombin and collagen were reduced. GPIb/V/IX and GPIIb/IIIa complexes were normal on flow cytometry.

evidence.dc:description: The proband was homozygous for the nonsense variant in exon 6, (NM_022081.5) Trp139Ter. NMD is predicted.

evidence.rdfs:label: Power_Patient 435
evidence.detectionMethod: WES was performed and the variant confirmed by Sanger sequencing.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Proband is noted to have pale skin and light brown hair. His iris transillumination score was 3.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: PT = 13.7 s (nv = 11.6-15.2s); aPTT = 32.7 (25.3-37.3s); Platelet count = 264K/uL (nv = 189-394K/uL); Mean dense bodies/platelet by whole-mount EM = 0.

evidence.dc:description: The proband and her sister were homozygous for a missense variant, Leu91Pro. The parents are noted to be heterozygous for this variant. In the absence of functional evidence, the variant is scored minimal points.

evidence.rdfs:label: Bastida_Patient P3
evidence.detectionMethod: NGS panel for variants in 72 genes related to inherited platelet disorders was done.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Proband's bleeding score was 7. She had oculocutaneous albinism. At 22y, proband had severe rectal bleeding.

evidence.dc:description: Light ear (le/le) mice have a spontaneously occurring defect in the Hps gene in C3H/HeJ mice, which causes a phenotype similar to Hermansky-Pudlak syndrome seen in humans. This paper identifies the genetic defect underlying the phenotype in mice. le mice show hypopigmentation of the ears, tail, feet, newborn eyes and juvenile coat and have enlarged lysosomes in the kidney, with increased concentration of lysosomal enzymes. Secretion of these enzymes into the urine is reduced. Bleeding time is prolonged due to platelet storage pool deficiency and reduced number of platelet dense granules. EM showed reduced number and aberrantly and unevenly pigmented melanosomes in the RPE of le mouse eyes. Melanosomes ranges in size with many macromelanosomes and atypical aggregates of normal-sized melanosomes.
evidence.rdfs:label: Suzuki_Mouse

evidence.dc:description: The animal model is scored reduced points as there are no functional studies that explain the impact of the HPS4 mutation in catfish

The experiment was performed in the Auburn university channel catfish population. Catfish i unavailable in the drop down list of animal models and therefore zebrafish was selected. Albinism is noted to be a naturally occurring phenotype in channel catfish. Albino catfish are noted to be pinkish white in color with bright red eyes.
evidence.rdfs:label: Li_Channel Catfish

evidence.dc:description: HPS1 is a subunit of the BLOC-3 complex, which it forms together with HPS4. The complex is involved in biogenesis of specialized organelles of the endosomal-lysosomal system.
evidence.rdfs:label: Suzuki_Function similar to HPS1

evidence.dc:description:
Epitope-tagged wildtype or mutant HPS1 and HPS4 constructs were transfected into HeLa or M1 cells. Coimmunoprecipitation experiments on cell lysates revealed interaction between HPS1 and HPS4 that involved the N-terminal and central region of HPS4. Truncated HPS1 (Puerto Rican 16-bp duplication variant) was also shown to interact with HPS4, indicating that the N-terminal of HPS1 is sufficient for the interaction.

HPS1 along with HPS4 forms the BLOC-3 complex. Mutations in HPS1 also result in Hermansky Pudlak syndrome.
evidence.rdfs:label: Carmona-Rivera_PI with HPS1
